Posts.Content: May 29, 2009 06:36AM rosiesmom wrote: Thanks. I wound up having three FNAs instead of the mammotome. There was some confusion with my MRI. The doctor is going back and having the radiologist reread the MRI with her there. The FNA produced fluid in two and cells in another. In a little bit of pain, but now waiting to see where this is going. Thanks.
Posts.Title: Scheduled for an ultrasound mammotome biopsy rosiesmom lesjules

Posts.Content: rosiesmom wrote: Has anyone had an ultrasound mammotome biopsy? I have one scheduled for tomorrow. I wondered how uncomfortable were you afterward? How many days could you not lift anything heavy? What is it like? I am a little nervous -- okay actually a lot nervous. I am a 34 yeard old mother of an active 18 month old. My husband is going with me me tomorrow.  I had three suspicious areas found on an MRI. The scheduling nurse told me to prepare for the mammotome procedure. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Scheduled for an ultrasound mammotome biopsy rosiesmom lesjules

Posts.Content: May 29, 2009 12:46AM rosiesmom wrote: Thanks... Still nervous!!! :) More worried about the pain after word. Will keep posted.

Posts.Content: rosiesmom wrote: I had a very small amount of DCIS found on one breast and a ton of a atypia on both. I decided to go with a bilateral mastectomy. I found out today, they are doing a sentinal node biopsy. One, can you tell me what that is like. Two, is that normal? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Sentinal Node Biopsy and DCIS rosiesmom Ruthlo

Posts.Content: rosiesmom wrote: Not sure if this is the right area or not, but I am wondering if anyone has experienced this. I had a mastectomy over four years ago. I had implant reconstruction. Recently, I have been experiencing a very sharp, pulling pain that comes and goes. When it heightens it is horrible. I was given muscle relaxers by my Family Doctor (which I hate, and I am not sure if it stops it or knocks me out so I don't notice it). I am seeing the NP at my surgeon's office tomorrow. Have any of you experienced this? I can tell there is some swelling. I am trying not to worry, but well, anything in there makes me worry. Have you experienced it? What caused it? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: More than 4 years post mastectomy and sharp pain rosiesmom bluepearl
